thread.title: The horrific foot injuries mystery creature inflicted on Phuket tourist
thread.title_full: The horrific foot injuries mystery creature inflicted on Phuket tourist | Daily Mail Online

author: John Hutchinson for MailOnline
title: The horrific foot injuries mystery creature inflicted on Phuket tourist
text:
15 shares 18
View
comments
These photographs the horrific aftermath of an attack on a pregnant woman by a mystery sea creature which tore a chunk of flesh out of her foot.
Jane Neame, from Australia, was swimming in waist-deep water at Karon beach in Phuket, Thailand, when something bit her foot, causing two deep lacerations.
After screaming for help, lifeguards and her partner Robert Passmore rushed into the water to pull the expectant mother onto the beach.
A mystery sea creature took a chunk of flesh out of Ms Neame's foot at Karon beach in Phuket
Emergency services were called to attend to the stricken, and pregnant, Australian tourist
Karon chief lifeguard Uten Singsom told Phuket News that he has 'never seen this kind of injury in his entire life.'
'When we arrived, she was laying on the beach with one foot bleeding heavily,' Karon Municipality Tourist Rescue Center Chief Supachai Janpen said.
The 37-year-old was then taken to Patong Hospital where she underwent surgery, and will remain under observation for a few more days.
 Australian pregnant woman suffers a severed ankle tendon... The female solo backpacker who braved civil war to capture... Are we there yet? 'Big Crazy Family Adventure' sees parents... From a crocodile loose in the cabin to lost flights in the... 15 shares But mystery surrounds just what the creature was that attacked the Australian tourist at the holiday hotspot.
Speaking to the Phuket News, shark expert Tessapon Krajangdara, believes it is unlikely the culprit was a shark.
'It is very rare for tourist to be bitten like this, and I have not been able to confirm precisely which kind of fish bit Ms Neame's foot,' he said.
The creature had also bit the woman on the underside of her foot, as well as severing tendons
Jane Neame (right) is holidaying with her partner, Robert Passmore (left), in Thailand
But Dr Kongkiat Kittiwattanawong, head of the Marine Endangered Species Unit, told Coconut News Bangkok that he thinks a shark is responsible for the bite, after 'taking a look at the teeth marks.'
He said: 'If we are able to prove that it was a shark attack, we will advise the governor to issue a warning to tourist in affected swimming zones.'
He did, however, say that there had never been a report of a shark attack at this spot previously.
Witnesses tell the police what they saw as the woman was attacked in shallow waters on the beach
Such was the ferociousness of the bite, it has severed tendons in the Australian's foot that left two toes drooping.
In an interview to the Phuket Gazette , with her boyfriend by her side at the hospital, Ms Neame said: 'It’s very painful. It severed my tendon. The fish took it away.'
She added: 'I may have stood on it, and then it bit me. It’s hard to say because it bit underneath my foot and on top. I felt it tear at me. It felt like a shark.'
A spokesman for the Bangkok Hospital Phuket said Ms Neame underwent surgery on Tuesday.
Ms Neame and Mr Passmore were on the third day of their holiday when the incident occurred.
Jane Neame, 37, was swimming at Karon Beach (pictured), on the west coast of Phuket
